We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The clinical presentation and laboratory findings suggest rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis. The renal biopsy confirms the diagnosis of crescentic glomerulonephritis. Methylprednisolone is the most appropriate treatment for this condition as it is a form of immunosuppressant therapy. Rituximab is used in autoimmune disorders and B-cell lymphomas, but not for crescentic glomerulonephritis. Lisinopril is an ACE inhibitor used to decrease proteinuria in chronic kidney disease but not for crescentic glomerulonephritis. Cyclosporine A is used for the treatment of chronic immune-mediated diseases, but it is not the preferred treatment for crescentic glomerulonephritis.
